3. Level 1 is most urgent (immediate life-saving intervention needed) down to Level 5 (least urgent).
4. It's designed to be rapid and user-friendly for nurses.

The main difference from other models is its focus on predicting resource needs alongside urgency. For example, the Canadian Triage and Acuity Scale (CTAS) focuses more on symptom severity and wait time targets.
